name: casting, brass | casting, brass | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7862/documentation

This dataset describes the casting of 1 kg of brass, for CH in 2003.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.];All data are calculated based on assumptions and theoretical models. The overall quality of the dataset is poor, making it of insufficient quality for LCA where these metals play an important role.

Casting process starting from melted brass.

This activity ends with the casting of brass ingots.

The dataset includes the consumption of infrastructure for the process.

The dataset doesn't include the metal inputs for the process.
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/243:Casting of metals/2432:Casting of non-ferrous metals

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Production is basically done by the casting of ingots. Due to the high vapour pressure of zinc and tin, parts of these inputs arise as air emissions. Filters are commonly used to abate these emissions.;The casting needs the moulds and energy for melting the alloy. Moulds are either made of metal (steel) or of sand.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data relate to the European average.

exchanges.description:
Proxy: "aluminium casting facility" is used as a proxy for brazing solder production facility.

Estimation from dataset author: The amount of infrastructure corresponds to the volume of material throughput and thus is recalculated according to the different densities of aluminium and copper alloys. Then, Correction by density: From 2700 kg/m3 for infrastructure for aluminum casting, to 8470 kg/m3 for infrastructure for brass casting.
EcoSpold01Location=RER

Estimation from dataset author: Dust filters are commonly used to abate metal emissions.
